intro: Hemsleya changningensis, commonly known as the Changning arrowleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
